intro: Pithecoctenium catharinae, commonly known as the Catharina's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
